title: git-annex: content changed while it was being sent

labels.name: severity-important
labels.description: major effect on the usability of a package, without rendering it completely unusable to everyone

body:
On top of the fixes in https://github.com/datalad/datalad/pull/5607 there might still be another issues. I am seeing

```
content changed while it was being sent
```

Here is what I do:

```
% readlink -f .
/data/project/studyforrest/collection/tnt
% git annex copy --to inm7-storage --key MD5E-s190--e6e1f4d3923cfd861e23f0f4cb20fa03.mat
copy MD5E-s190--e6e1f4d3923cfd861e23f0f4cb20fa03.mat (to inm7-storage...) 

  content changed while it was being sent
failed
git-annex: copy: 1 failed
```

It is reliably happening repeatedly, for the same keys, but not all keys. The keyname never changes, an `annex fsck` come back clean. At the end, the server-side does not have the key, not even in a transfer directory.

Below is a full debug log. @bpoldrack what do you think this could be?

<details>
<summary> Annex debug log</summary>

```
% git annex --debug copy --to inm7-storage --
```
